p: 7. Theory and practice. Practical activity is not theoretical knowledge, but neither is it blind. The difference between theory and practice is not (1) that theory observes whereas practice acts or (2) that practice applies theoretical knowledge to practical ends. Both theory and practice are equally basic ways of being concerned with things, but practical activity has its own kind of knowing. Theoretical knowing sees something, but without practical foresight [into how to change it]. Absent such foresight, theory works with its own rules, which take the form of method.
